content:
While there may not be exact duplicates of The Last of Us Part II's single-player experience, I can suggest some multiplayer games that share similar elements, such as post-apocalyptic settings, co-op gameplay, and intense action. Here are a few recommendations:

1. **Days Gone** (PS4): This action-adventure game is set in a post-apocalyptic Oregon, where you'll fight hordes of zombies-like creatures called Freakers. It has a strong focus on co-op play, allowing you to team up with friends to complete missions and take down enemies.
2. **Destiny 2** (PS4, Xbox One, PC): While not exactly similar to The Last of Us Part II, Destiny 2 is a first-person shooter with MMO elements, a large open world, and a variety of co-op modes, including Strikes, Raids, and Patrols.
3. **Overkill's The Walking Dead** (PS4, Xbox One, PC): This co-op shooter is set in The Walking Dead universe and focuses on teamwork, strategy, and scavenging for supplies in a post-apocalyptic Washington D.C.
4. **World War Z** (PS4, Xbox One, PC): Inspired by the movie of the same name, this co-op shooter challenges you and your friends to survive against massive hordes of zombies in various locations around the world.
5. **State of Decay 2** (Xbox One, PC): This open-world survival game lets you team up with friends to explore a post-apocalyptic world, scavenge for supplies, and build a community to fend off hordes of zombies.
6. **Warframe** (PS4, Xbox One, PC, Switch): This free-to-play cooperative third-person shooter features a sci-fi setting, a variety of playable characters with unique abilities, and a large selection of missions and game modes.
7. **Outriders** (PS4, PS5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X/S, PC): This co-op RPG shooter, developed by People Can Fly, offers a mix of exploration, combat, and character progression in a post-apocalyptic world.
8. **Remnant: From the Ashes** (PS4, Xbox One, PC): This co-op action game is set in a post-apocalyptic world where you'll fight against monstrous creatures and bosses in a variety of environments.

These games offer varying degrees of similarity to The Last of Us Part II, but all share elements of co-op gameplay, action, and post-apocalyptic settings. You can try them out to see which one resonates with you and your friends the most.
